benchmark_details.name: MultiChartQA
benchmark_details.overview: MultiChartQA is a benchmark that evaluates MLLMs' capabilities in four key areas: direct question answering, parallel question answering, comparative reasoning, and sequential reasoning, particularly in multi-chart scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the reasoning capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models in multi-chart scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The overall scale of the multi-chart sets is relatively limited due to the labor-intensive data collection process.

data.source: The benchmark draws from a diverse set of public resources containing multi-chart articles, including Arxiv, OECD, Our World in Data, among others.
data.annotation: All questions and answers in the benchmark are manually annotated.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is evaluated using relaxed accuracy for numerical answers and exact match for non-numeric answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better multi-chart reasoning capabilities of MLLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance averaged at 90.11% across all tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through performance measurements against human results.
